loans.use: to buy more oil, pepper, vita, onion, bitter-ball, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Doña Ana es una señora muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante de 44 años de edad la cual comparte hogar junto a su esposo y su única hija la cual tienen una edad de 16 años contribuyendo a las diferentes actividades en el hogar y en el campo. Doña Ana aprendió el rubro y oficio de la agricultura ya que desde muy pequeña apoyaba a su padre en la tierra que el cultivaba. Sus cultivos están ubicados en su misma comunidad a la cual se trasladan en vestía o caminando aproximadamente a una media hora. Doña Ana tiene un grado de educación primaria el cual curso hasta el tercer grado ya que la economía en su hogar no era la mejor en su juventud pero aprendió a trabajar fuertemente para educar su única hija.

Ella sueña con ver a su hija en un mejor futuro, con mejores oportunidades, mejores condiciones de vida para que pueda apoyar a su familia en todo lo necesario. por lo que ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades.
texts.en:
Ana is very enterprising and has a lot of will to move ahead in life.  She is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 16-year-old daughter, who help with the work both in the home and in the field.  Ana learned about agriculture from a very young age, as she supported her father on the land which he worked.  Ana's crops are grown in the community where she lives, and she arrives at her land by motorcycle taxi or by walking for half an hour.  Ana completed up to the end of third grade at school.  The family's financial situation was not great when Ana was young but she learned to be a good worker so that she could bring up her daughter.

Ana dreams of her daughter having a better future, with better opportunities and better living conditions, so that she can support her own family with everything that they need.  In order to work towards this goal, Ana is applying for a loan in order to improve her crops by giving them more help with farming supplies such as manure, fertiliser, coffee plant chemical, and fungicides (to avoid problems with bugs and diseases).

loans.use: to buy farming supplies in order to maintain and help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Badamkhand

texts.en:
Ms. Badamkhand is 22 years old and lives with her parents in Govisumber province of Mongolia. She is a 4th year student of private medical school in Ulaanbaatar city. She will be graduating her university in 2015 and she has so much passion for her future as doctor. 

She wanted to be a doctor when she was a little kid and pursued her dream and enrolled in medical school. She needs to pay her tuition fee and now requesting a loan of 1,900,000 MNT to pay her tuition fee for the 5th year medical school. 

She is a hardworking, enthusiastic and positive student.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee for the 5th year medical school.

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Mamusu from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children. In 2006, Mamusu established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., 7 days per week. 

She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problem. To travel from one village to another is very difficult.

Mamusu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Mamusu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a divorced woman, 40 years old, with five children. Of her five children, two are still attending universities. She lives in a rural setting with her family.

Aisha has a business where she sells second-hand bed clothing, like bed sheets and bed covers, as well as towels, curtains, and other items. She has been in this business for 10 years.  She supplements her family income with agriculture, where she grows bananas and coffee in season.

She has requested this loan in order to boost her business by adding other stock.  She sells her products to people from rural areas of Rakai district, since she takes her goods to all the markets around the district.

Her dream is to start another second-hand business for her daughter so that she can increase the family's income. Aisha faces the business challenge of lacking enough capital to run her business properly.

loans.use: To buy stocks of used bed linens to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 42-year-old married man who lives in Kasese, Uganda.  He operates a retail shop, and he is also involved in the transport business in order to earn a living.

Francis intends to use the loan to buy rice and sugar to sell.  Like most traders he is challenged by price fluctuations and inadequate capital, while his dream is to trade in wholesale.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Tememsu Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tamemsu” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. 

This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Ramatu, who is 40 years old.  She was born in the Masumana village, in northern Sierra Leone.  She is married to a trader, and together, the couple has four children who are attending primary and secondary school. 

Ramatu sells palm oil (Sierra Leone's most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, dried fish, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy those items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, dried fish, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is married with two children, and both of her children go to school.  She doesn’t have additional family members to take care of. 

She has a business stall selling snacks and stationery. She has applied for a loan of UGX 60,0000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sweets, biscuits, handkerchiefs, pencils, pens, and books to sell. 

She has been in this business for three years and works six days out of every week. She generates extra income through working as a cleaner at a petrol station.  Her major business challenges are seasonality and holidays, because her customers are mainly university students.

Agatha aspires to see her business grow into a retail shop and also to build her own house so as to stop renting.  She resides in  a rented house; the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more sweets, biscuits, pens, pencils, books, and handkerchiefs to sell

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en:
Tariq is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with his wife and son. He owns a small jewelry shop in which he sells artificial jewelry such as bracelets, bangles, lockets, necklaces, rings and earrings. He makes golden jewelry on demand also.

As we know, the gold prices have been globally increasing, so the customers like to buy artificial jewelry instead of golden jewelry. But most of the rich persons give him orders sometimes for making golden jewelry.
 
This time, the same situation is happening but in large quantity. He has taken an order for making golden jewelry; the customer has given some cash in advance too. But still, now the purchase of gold are beyond Tariq's financial capacity. 

Therefore, Tariq requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s, BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy the gold and fulfill the order on specific duration. With the help of the profit amount, he will buy the artificial jewelry over his shop to sell.
 
He hopes that through this loan he will be able to buy gold, fulfill the order, and get more profits than earlier.
 
Tariq is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan .

loans.use: to buy gold for making jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Hassanatu

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Hassanatu from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 1 and 5 years old. For over 5 years, Hassanatu established her retails business. She was a house wife, but she began this business to help her husband support the children and take care of her parent. She works at the business for 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that at the present, her business is doing well.

Hassanatu requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits, and sugar for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Hassanatu plans to open a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Las Preciosas Group

texts.es:
El Banco de emprendimiento LAS PRECIOSAS
está  compuesto por nueve  integrantes siete mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Silvia tiene 36 años y un hijo de la edad de doce años,  ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y joyas por catalogo,  ella vende de manera ambulante visitando instituciones públicas y privadas, barrios distintos domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Silvia va a usar este préstamo  para comprar joyas que se encuentran en promoción para tener en stock para su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener variedad de productos para  satisfacer a sus  clientes, la Sra. Silvia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atender  con eficiencia a sus clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank "Las Preciosas" is made up of 9 members - 7 women and 2 men. The bank's president is Silvia, 36, mother of a 12-year-old son. She sells cosmetics and jewelry from a catalog, going door to door to public and private institutions, different neighborhoods and homes offering her products. 

This is her second loan with the institution. Silvia will use it to buy jewelry that is on sale so that she has it in stock for her business. Her reason for requesting a loan is to have a variety of products to satisfy her customers. Silvia's business faces challenges like attending to her customers efficiently. She will use the profits to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy jewelry in bulk.

loans.name: Twitange Group

texts.en:
Hadija, an active member of Twitange group, is married and blessed with a baby girl. Hadija, who is in her mid 20s, is running a business selling mobile phones. She has been in this business for three years now. Hadija starts working from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily, and is able to make a very good monthly profit.
 
From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Hadija's seventh loan request, which she will use to restock more mobile phones to resell. She used her previous loans to buy more mobile phones and increased on her amount to buy a HiAce (mini-bus) for business. Hadija has paid back all her previous loans successfully. 

She dreams that one day she will be able to expand her business more and build a house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Twitange, which consists of five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more mobile phones to resell.

loans.name: Sinan's Group

texts.en:
Sinan is a resident of the Sangke district of Battambang province.  She is the 35-year-old mother of three schoolchildren. 

Currently, her main sources of income are rice farming and a business selling desserts.  This is the seventh loan for Sinan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans with success, and they have enabled her to improve her standard of living gradually and keep her kids in school. 

For this cycle, she has teamed up in a group of four to get a new loan from VisionFund.  The total amount of her entire group is KHR 4,400,000, of which KHR 1,400,000 is her loan portion. 

As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop and piglets for raising for additional income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop and piglets to raise

loans.name: Jones

texts.en:
Jones is a thirty-three year old married man. He has one child. His family lives in Kasese, Uganda.

Jones has been selling cassava flour for four years. He also farms to earn additional income. His major business challenges are competition and price fluctuation. His dream is to diversify and trade in other foods. Jones intends to use the loan to buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Irma Angelica

texts.es:
Doña Irma tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos los cuales ayudan en las diferentes actividades que en el campo se practican como: limpieza, aplicación de abono, fertilizantes, fungicidas, etc. las cuales dan protección a sus cultivos de café manteniéndolos sanos y saludables para el final de la cosecha. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual curso con mucho esfuerzo y apoyo por parte de sus padres a pesar de la poca economía. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en dichas actividades ya que fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y en compañía de su pareja lo practica hace más de 7 años. El terreno que ellos en familia trabajan es propio gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres el cual está ubicado a 30 minutos de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada a pie diariamente.

Sus metas son las de poder comprar otro terreno en donde ella pueda cultivar otra variedad de café mucho más atractiva para poder ofrecer a sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos, de esa manera ella podrá fortalecer el patrimonio familiar para sus hijos. Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita un financiamiento para comprar insumos agrícolas como 8 sacos de abono, 6 litros de foliares, 6 litros de boro y 800 chapolas (plantillas de café) para dar mantenimiento y preparar una nueva cosecha para la próxima temporada
texts.en:
Irma is 31 years old, married and the mother of two children. They help her with the various activities in the fields such as cleaning, applying fertilizer, fungicides etc. These protect the coffee crops keeping them intact and healthy for harvest. 

Irma completed her Primary Education degree into which she put in a lot of effort and had the support of her parents in spite of their modest economic situation. She has a lot of experience in the agricultural activities as her parents taught her to work the land. Along with her husband they have farmed for seven years. The land they grow on is theirs as she inherited it from her parents. It is located 30 minutes distance from their house, which they walk daily. Her goal is to be able to buy another plot of land, where she would grow a different, much more popular type of coffee that she could offer to her clients and generate higher income. This would fortify the family estate for her children. 

Today she is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as 8 bags of fertilizer, 6 liters of foliar sprays, 6 liters of boron and 800 seedlings (young coffee plants) to grow and prepare for a new harvest in the following season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and seedlings to plant and care for.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a twenty-seven year old married man. He has two children. His family lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

Charles runs a retail shop. He also works as a casual laborer. His major business challenges are low pay and price fluctuation. His dream is to own a wholesale shop. Charles intends to use the loan to buy sugar, washing soap, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, washing soap, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: A young married lady residing in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Mom is 25 years old and strives for a living via grocery selling.  This is the business that she has had for two years. To earn additional income, her husband works as a paid-worker. Mom has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for six loans in the past and has fully repaid those loans. Her past loans have enabled her to relieve her family’s burden and improve her livelihood. Now, she forms a group of two to seek for a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more grocery items including soap, food ingredients, canned food, etc., for resale. She hopes to expand her grocery selling business and make a good income so as she can set aside some money when she gets old.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine used the previous loan to pay school fees and repaid it. She is a thirty-seven-year-old, hard-working lady with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is selling second hand shoes. With the proceeds from this business she has been able to educate her children. Her future vision is to buy land for constructing a good home and educating her children to higher levels despite inadequate capital. Christine intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Marta Antonia

texts.es:
Doña Marta es una mujer de 50 años de edad una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante que junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura con el cual procreo 2 hijos los cuales trabajan en la tierra de sus padres apoyándolos con las diferentes actividades que se realizan en el campo. Doña Marta aprendió este oficio desde que era muy pequeña siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra ya que ellos son agricultores por generaciones. Sus cultivos lo tienen ubicado en una comunidad cercana la cual está ubicada a unos 40 minutos aproximadamente de camino. Doña Marta tiene un grado de educación primaria completado y diariamente trabaja fuertemente para darle lo mejor a sus hijos para que ellos puedan estar mejor y con mayores oportunidades de esa manera ella podrá tener esperanzas para cuando ella y su esposo envejezcan tener un apoyo por parte de ellos.

Sus sueños y planes a futuro como madre es ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones de vida, con mejores oportunidades de empleo y con una tierra donde vivir y trabajar. Para su negocio poder sembrar una mayor cantidad y variedad de producto para de esa manera fortalecer sus tierras y fortalecer la economía en su hogar. Por los que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual ella pueda inyectar capital a sus cultivos protegiéndolos con los diferentes insumos que comprara como abono, fertilizantes, fungicidas entre otros que harán de la temporada una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Doña Marta is a woman of 50. She is an entrepreneurial woman with a great will to advance. She works in agriculture along with her husband, with whom she has two children, who work on the land of their parents, helping them in the various activities that they carry out in the fields. Doña Marta learned this work when she was very small; her parents were the ones who taught her to work the land, since her family have been farmers for generations. Her plantings are located in a nearby community, which is about a 40-minute walk away. Doña Marta completed primary education, and she works hard every day to give the best to her children, so that they can be better and have greater opportunities. In this way she will be able to have hopes for when she and her husband are old, to have support from them.

As a mother, her dreams and plans for the future are to see her children have better living conditions, with better employment opportunities, and with land where they can live and work. For her business, she hopes to be able to plant a greater quantity and variety of products so that in this way she can build up her land and strengthen her household economy. For these reasons, she has now applied for a loan with which she can inject capital into her plantings, protecting them with different supplies that she can buy, such as compost, fertilizers, and fungicides, among other items, which will give a good harvest this season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fungicides, and compost, among other items, to help her coffee plantings.

loans.name: Darlyn Jasmania

texts.es: Darlyn es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco. Tiene 24 años de edad, casada, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería desde hace 3 años. Esta agradecida con su familia por el apoyo que le han brindado, ya que ha podido salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para el pago de alquiler de los potreros donde mantiene a sus animales. Tiene como expectativa reproducir su ganado, con el fin de aumentar su inventario y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su meta es realizar siembra de maíz y trigo, logrando obtener ganancias a través de esta cosecha, la cual será de beneficio para comercializarla. Su plan futuro es comprar vacas, con el fin de reproducir  su ganado y sacar derivados como leche,  queso, crema entre otros. Considera que el crédito será de importancia para cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Darlyn is a native of the city of Boaco. She is 24 years old and is married. She has been working in agriculture and livestock raising for three years. She is grateful to her family for the support that they have offered her, since she has been able to get ahead. She is applying for the loan to pay the rent for the pastures where she keeps her animals. She expects her livestock to reproduce, with the goal of increasing her inventory and having a better quality of life. Her goal is to complete a planting of corn and wheat and obtain earnings through their harvest, which will be beneficial to sell. Her future plan is to buy cows, with the goal of having them reproduce and getting products such as milk, cheese, and cream, among others. She feels that the loan will be important in completing her goals.

loans.use: to pay the rent for her pastures.

loans.name: Señor De La Esperanza De Huaripache Group

texts.es: Leidy tiene 27 años es soltera con dos hijas pequeñas educando. Hace seis mese Leidy  presta servicio de serenazgo  en las horas de la noche  para poder dedicar en el día a sus hijos. Años trabajaba en los trabajos municipales de la zona en donde radica. El préstamo que obtuvo lo invertirá en el inicio de un pequeño negocio de lencería y medias. El mayor deseo de Leidy es tener una casa propia. Leidy en el grupo “SEÑOR DE LA ESPERANZA DE HUARIPACHE” cumple la función de presidenta. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Leidy es la tercera del lado derecho viste palera gris. Y de la misma manera está incluida la foto de de luisa en la parte superior derecha que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en:
Leidy is 27 years old, single and she has two young daughters being educated. Leidy has been serving as a night municipal guard for the past six months in order to take care of her children during the day. She's been carrying out municipal jobs for years in the area where she lives.

She will invest the loan to start a small lingerie and stockings business. Leidy's greatest wish is to have her own home. Leidy is the president of the "Señor de la Esperanza de Huaripache" group. The group is very thankful to the Kiva lenders for the loan. 

Leidy is the third person from the right and is wearing a grey top. Luisa's photo is inserted on the top right since she was unable to attend the meeting for work-related reasons.

loans.use: to purchase lingerie and stockings

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette is 39 years old. She sells fruit and has been running the business for the past ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more pineapple to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more pineapple to sell

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with two children and both her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in the family house and they have access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills. 

She has a business selling charcoal and has been in business for 9 years. She doesn’t have another income generating activity. She works from home seven days a week selling charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Jully

texts.en:
This is Jully from Liberia. She is 30 years old and married to a local businessman and has three children who are between 3 and 12. She was unable to attend school, but she has engaged herself in business to make a living. She is good at managing this business, which she has been involved with for 10 years: selling oil and beans in the local market. With the loan proceeds, she will buy the identical aforementioned goods to increase her sales. 

She said that besides few goods on her table market, she has no other problems for now. She received a little money from her husband to establish this business, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She enjoys the flow of her customers, and her plan is to increase her business even more.

loans.use: to buy oil and beans to increase her sales.

loans.name: Maria Angelina

texts.es: María Angelina de cuarenta años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia desde hace 3 años. Ella se dedica  la venta de pescado y medicina y su esposo vende minutas, los dos trabajan unidos para poder ganarse el pan de cada día; María es una mujer luchadora y muy trabajadora, siempre está buscando buenas oportunidades que le ayuden a salir adelante, vive en las afueras de la ciudad y desde hace algún tiempo quiere reparar el cuarto de la cocina, necesita cambio de techo porque se filtra el agua, también quiere encementar el piso de la casa ya que es de tierra; por sus bajos recursos económicos no puede costear el gasto, por lo tanto no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde, por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, lamina galvanizada, arena. María Angelina se siente muy agradecida con la ayuda y se compromete a cancelar toda la deuda.
texts.en:
María Angelina is 54 years old and lives with her life companion and their two children in a house they have owned for the past three years.  She sells fish and medicines while her husband sells quick meals.  Together the two of them have been able to provide from the daily needs of their family. 

María is a determined and hardworking woman who is always looking for good opportunities that will help her get ahead.  She lives on the outskirts of the city.  Some time ago, she wanted to repair the kitchen since the roof overhead leaks.  She also wants to install a cement floor in her house since there is only dirt at the moment.  Since she has limited resources, María is not able to cover this expense and does not have sufficient capital in reserve.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can buy cement, galvanized metal sheets, and sand.  María Angelina is very grateful for this assistance and promises to repay the entire debt.

loans.use: to buy cement, galvanized metal sheets, and sand so that she can repair the roof over her kitchen and install a floor.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 26-year-old married woman with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is involved in a bakery and also runs a bar alongside farming in order to boost her income. She faces hardships of customers who delay paying on time and price fluctuation. 

Rose is requesting a loan to buy beer and wheat flour for her business. She dreams of owning a modern bar and buying land to build a good house.

loans.use: to buy beer and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy unit.

loans.name: Assumption

texts.en:
Assumpson is a resident of Kakoba, a suburb in the Mbarara municipality. She has five children and all are in school. She got married when she was 18 years old to a man she loved. But later the husband deserted the family and went abroad without the knowledge of the wife. Unfortunately, the family had no income-generating business, and Assumpson started to struggle for the survival of the children. That is when she got to know Ugafode microfinance and acquired a loan of 2,000,000 shillings, which helped her to start rearing goats on a small scale. Because of her hard work, this business developed and managed to support her family as well as paying school fees for the children.

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 shillings to buy more baby goats that she will breed to fatten and later sell.

loans.use: To buy baby goats.

loans.name: Isaya

texts.en:
Isaya used the previous loan to plant tea. He is a hard-working man with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He grows tea and with the profits earned from his tea plantation, he has been able to pay school fees for his child and has built rentals. His primary business challenges are price fluctuation and prolonged drought that affects the yields. 

Isaya dreams of educating his child up to the university level, and he hopes to eventually buy more land to expand his business. Isaya intends to use the loan to plant more tea.

loans.use: to plant more tea.

loans.name: Ahmed Mehmood

texts.en:
Ahmed is 30 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of a son; he expects that he will have more children in the future. Now his family’s expenses are very low, which will not remain constant in the future. Ahmed has compared his current monthly income with the rapid increase in inflation and concluded that his earnings will be lacking to cope with inflation in the future. So he decided that he should increase his business so that he can easily fulfill the household expenses and can provide comfort for his family.

Ahmed’s business is selling crockery. Through the sales of crockery items such as plates, dishes, cups, jars, glass, jugs, mugs, and buckets, he earns sufficient income for his family. He has been selling stylish crockery in the main market for many years. He also provides fancy crockery for dowry to his customers. The marriage season impacts a positive change over his sales and he earns maximum income in the marriage season.
 
Ahmad is not a landlord, he is just an ordinary person. He has been establishing his shop with efforts days and nights. He does not have enough savings to buy fancy crockery to offer his customers. He is taking loan to invest the full amount in the current business. He assured us that he will show his good payment behavior because he wants to take more loans from BRAC Pakistan. 

Ahmed presents his humble request to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy more fancy crockery to attract his customers and to increase the sales. 

Ahmed hopes that he will succeed and can maintain his standard of living and respect among his family in the future. 
Ahmed is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed him a beam of hope to fulfill his desires.

loans.use: to buy crockery for resale.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is a 66-year-old woman. She lives in Tkibuli district, eastern Georgia. Lia trades agate gems. The income from this business is not enough for her to cover everyday costs. Lia graduated from dental college. She decided to open a dental clinic with a loan and sought credit among financial institutions. All her attempts were rejected because of a lack of experience and financial stability. 

The startup program, which is joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, gives her a chance to get a loan of $2,000 and purchase dental equipment. As the equipment is purchased, she will open a clinic in her house and will serve local people from home. The startup program will be a great support for her to be involved in her own stable business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to open a dental clinic.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, a 39-year-old single mother of one from Matuu, owns a business selling cereals and other grains. She currently lacks the capital needed to purchase items in bulk to restock her store. Janet also practices horticultural farming, a business that supplements her income. 

With a loan through KADET LTD, Janet will be able to purchase cereals in bulk when she finds goods at low prices. She will then be able to have a fully stocked store, which will attract more customers, generate sales, and create more profit due to a lower cost of goods sold. Additional income created will allow her to reinvest in her business, meet the needs of her family and educate her son. 

In the future, Janet would like to eradicate poverty and uplift the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cereals in bulk.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 34 years old. She has been selling sugar and salt for the past 12 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sugar, salt, and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase building materials, a hair-washing station, chairs, a treatment table and cosmetic supplies.

loans.name: Bakereti

texts.en:
Bakereti is a 47-year-old married woman with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop for 18 years alongside farming to earn extra income. Like most traders she is challenged by price fluctuation and the high cost of rent. 

Bakereti dreams of owning a wholesale shop. She intends to use the loan to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  DANAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne 3  enfants. Elles vivent dans  des familles monogamiques à  HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme   Maimouna   fait la vente de pomme de terre dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est  debout  en troisième position de la  gauche  vers la  droite sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  600 kg de pomme de terre. Elle vend ses articles au marché et à la maison. Elle vend au comptant à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are married women who on average are 36 years old with three children. They live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They are on their fifth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, in order to satisfy their customers'  needs.

Maimouna sells potatoes in this group of women. She is standing in the third position from left to right in the photo.

She intends to use the loan to buy 600 kgs of potatoes. She retails her products at the market and at home. She sells for cash to a customer base of women and men.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used to pay the loan and its interest, and the remainder put into savings.

loans.use: buy potatoes

loans.name: Ernesto Jose

texts.es: Don Ernesto tiene 57 años de edad, es originario de la ciudad de Boaco, casado y padre de 2 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de artículos de ferretería, desde hace 10 años. Gracias al empeño y arduo trabajo que ha realizado para su negocio, logro aumentar sus ingresos, lo cual es ha sido de satisfacción para su entorno familiar. Cuenta con el apoyo de  su esposa, quien comercializa los productos en su casa. Tiene como otra fuente de ingresos remesas que recibe del extranjero. Solicita el crédito para comprar: candados, llaves, clavos, extensiones, martillos, pintura, serruchos entre otros con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y diversificar su negocio. Estima que el financiamiento será de mucha ayuda para crecer como comerciante. Su plan futuro es implementar nuevos productos como materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 57 years old and a native of the city of Boaco. He is married and the father of two children. His profession is that of salesman and for the past ten years he has sold hardware items. Thanks to his determination and the hard work he has put into his business, Ernesto has been able to increase his income, which has satisfied his family. Ernesto has the support of his wife, who sells the hardware products from their home. Their other source of income is remittances that they receive from abroad. 

Ernesto requests a loan to purchase, among other things: locks, keys, nails, extension cords, hammers, paint and saws. By making these purchases he intends to satisfy the needs of his clients and to diversify his business. He believes that the financing will greatly help him grow as a salesman. Ernesto's plan for the future is to add new types of products, such as construction materials, to his business.

loans.use: to purchase locks, keys, nails, extension cords, hammers, paints and saws.

loans.name: Beyata

texts.en: Beyata is a thirty-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For four years she has been in agriculture and the sector has been very lucrative, since she gets most of the money for her children's school fees from farming. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations affect her business growth, while her dream is to venture into modern farming activities. Beyata intends to use the loan to buy seeds and pay for labor for her farm.

loans.use: To pay for seeds, labor and farm chemicals.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en: Jesca is a thirty-two-year-old widow with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been practicing agriculture for four years but also makes liquid soap in order to earn a living. Prolonged rainy seasons and inadequate capital hinder her business growth, while her dream is to become a commercial farmer. Jesca intends to use the loan to pay workers who are weeding her garden.

loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding her garden.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is a fifty-four-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. For thirteen years he has been farming, and he also started a retail shop in order to meet his family's daily expenses since farming is seasonal. Wild animals and price fluctuations are his greatest challenges, while his dream is to become a model farmer. Deo intends to use the loan to pay for labor and buy seeds for planting.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 20-year-old woman who lives in Pakistan with her husband and daughter. Her husband is a property dealer whose income is too low to cover their household expenses. Shaheen herself has been running a beauty salon for two years. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase cosmetic products like lipstick, facial creams, etc. as well as chairs for her salon. With the profits she will first pay back her loan to Kiva, and then she will purchase a variety of cosmetic products for the salon. She wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so co-operative.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products like lipstick, facial creams, etc. and some furniture.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a second-time borrower of the institution applying for ugx.3,000,000. He is a married man of four children, who he stays with in his unfinished house. He is 55 years old. He is a mechanic and that is what has enabled him look after his family by providing the basic needs and educating his children. John has a challenge of solely depending on income from one source. He has hope that given the loan, he will be able to finish constructing his small house and also be able to build a rental unit as a way of enhancing his income. 

He has future plans of borrowing more money from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd and making sure he repays well as a way of building a good credit history with the institution, so that the institution lends him larger amounts of money to have many rental houses constructed and therefore increase his income.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en: Gocha is 27 years old. He lives with his parents and grandmother in a small village in Khulo district. His grandmother is provided with a retirement pension. The family has a cow. Gocha's mother milks the cow every day and produces cheese to sell. They also have a plot of agricultural land, where maize and walnut trees are grown. They always have high-quality products, which are sold to local retailers. Along with these agricultural businesses, Gocha decided to start a transportation business. He sought a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. His credit requests were rejected several times, as he was unable to satisfy their requirements. Gocha received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - a startup program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the received loan of $2800, Gocha will purchase a minibus and start a transportation business. He already has a driver's license. Gocha hopes that the business will be profitable and that he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a forty-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He sells agricultural produce and with the proceeds he has been able to educate his children. High cost of transport and unpredictable weather changes affect his profit projections, while his dream is to own a food store that can supply his customers all year round. Nicholas intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Tata

texts.fr:
Madame TATA  est née vers 1974 à SAN. Mère de 7 enfants, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire à LAFIABOUGOU, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame  TATA mène le commerce il y a environ dix ans.Elle change les activités suivant les périodes propices. Présentement elle mène l’activité d’achat et de vente des tubercules (pomme de terre, ignames et patates), et des fruits. Elle mène son activité à son domicile et de façon ambulante dans la ville où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, elle est à son  treizième prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter  30 sacs de tubercules et des des paniers de fruits. Elle achète ses marchandises sur place au marché avant de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce , contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tata was born around 1974 in San. Mother of seven children, she lives with her husband and their children in a nuclear family in Lafiabougou, one of the districts in the periphery of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mrs. Tata has been a retail merchant for the past ten years. She changes her activities depending on favorable periods. Currently her activity is to buy and sell tubers (potatoes, yams and sweet potatoes) and fruit.

She performs her activity at home and as an itinerant vendor in the city where she is in high demand by her customers for the quality of her products.

To meet her increasingly growing number of customers, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution.  She is on her thirteenth individual loan she will use to buy 30 bags of tubers and baskets of fruit.

She buys her goods at the local market before selling retail to a clientele consisting of women and men. Previous loans have been repaid in full.

She intends to achieve monthly profits of 100,000 CFA francs which will be used to expand her business, contribute to family expenses and pay interest on the loan.

loans.use: buy tubers and fruit

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
Meet 48-year-old Tenneh from Jui in the eastern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with five children between the ages of 11 and 30 years old. Ten years ago, Tenneh established her foodstuff business within her environment. She began her business to improve her family. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuations and transportation costs.

Tenneh requires a loan in order to purchase bags of sugar for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Tenneh plans to open a food store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of sugar for resale.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Chizi prepares goat meat and soup using goat head and legs and sells it to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. She also operates a kiosk shop.

With the KES 80,000 she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Kono Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Kono” group. These small-scale entrepreneurs have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 600,000.00 SLL for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Aminata is the featured leader of this group. Aminata is 40 years old and married with two children who are attending primary schools.  Aminata sells clothes. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is 51 and is the mother of four children. Her husband has grown old and stays at home. Her elder son owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrical goods and provides services for repairing electrical components, such as ceiling fans and washing machines and troubleshoots the underground electrical supply. He sells electrical components such as bulbs, switches, sockets, etc. in his shop as well.

He wants to buy new electrical goods and tools for his shop but does not have the amount to buy new inventory. Therefore, Shaheen made a request to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son could become empowered to buy his desired inventory. Shaheen says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods and tools for services.

loans.name: Rina's Group

texts.en: Rina, age 29 and a villager from Battambang province, is the mother of two little kids. To support her daily cost of living, she not only grows rice but also stocks rice for resale when it reaches a high price. This business returns about 36,000 KHR per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Rina is in her fourth cycle loan seeking 1,400,000 KHR, whereas her other two joint borrowers are in their second cycle loan seeking 1,200,000 KHR each. The past loans, which she has repaid, have enabled her to promptly support her business timely. For this cycle, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to pay the plowing and reaping fee and to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can expand her business better than before.

loans.use: To pay the plowing and reaping fee and to buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica appreciated her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Joyce from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children between the ages of one year and 13 years. For the past four years, Joyce established her retail business within the environment. She began her business to help her husband take care of the children. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the slow purchasing power of customers.

Joyce requires a loan in order to purchase palm oil and soap to prepare her soap business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future Joyce plans to open a food store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and soap to prepare her soap business.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DANAYA est constitué de 5 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de38 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO CENTRE de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4éme prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce et de la restauration à l’image de MAGNON qui est  la femme assise   dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 200Kg de riz et des condiments avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya group consists of five married women who on average are 38 years old with two children. They live in traditional extended families in the Heremakono Centre neighborhood of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to better manage their business activities, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their fourth credit loan. The three previous loans have been fully repaid.

This group of women is active in retail commerce and the restaurant business such as Magnon, the woman sitting in the photo. She intends to use the loan to buy  200 kgs of rice and condiments from wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells from home, for cash or credit, to a clientele consisting mainly of women.

She expects average monthly profits of 40,000 CFA francs, to be invested in the business and to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy rice and condiments for restaurant business

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru:
Умеда всегда отличалась вежливостью, старательностью, активностью и стремлению к своей цели. Она дизайнер женской одежды. Ей всего 27 лет, но Умеда твердо знает свое призвание в жизни. Умеда мать двоих детей и верная супруга. Пока ее муж работает заграницей, она следит за детьми и работает в ателье. Ей очень нравиться шить, творить, создавать новый стиль одежды. Умеда хочет поделиться своим талантом с другими молодыми дизайнерами. Умеда собрала кружок девочек-учениц.
Умеда запрашивает кредит для покупки разных видов тканей и ниток, чтобы ученицы могли выполнить свои первые работы. Умеда любит свое дело. Она каждый день идет на работу как на праздник, и хочет, чтоб ее ученицы почувствовали то же самое.
texts.en:
Umeda has always stood out as kind, diligent and active towards achieving her goals. She is a designer of women's clothing. She is 27 years old, but Umeda firmily knows her calling in life. Umeda is a mother of two children and a loyal wife. While her husband is working abroad she looks after the children and works in the sewing shop. She likes to sew, create and invent a new style of clothing very much. Umeda wants to share her talent with the other young designers. She has put together a group of girls students.

Umeda is asking for a loan to buy different kinds of fabrics and threads so that her students can complete their first works. Umeda loves what she does. She goes to work with great pleasure every day and wants for her students to feel the same.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Nueva Esperanza está formada por 8 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por la belleza natural que la rodea y por su belleza arquitectónica, esta bañada por 4 ríos y es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad. Nuestras. Las socias son mujeres muy alegres y de un gran carisma que siempre buscan la manera de mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y así salir adelante. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Verónica, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 5 y 2 años, su primer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado público, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Verónica pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo al cuidado de sus hijos que aun son pequeños, pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, trabaja todos los días y se encuentra en este negocio desde hace 3 años, también vende ropa por catalogo. 

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de  cosméticos y ropa  para crecer en el negocio. 

Su meta es viajar y conocer varios países.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomola foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza [New Hope] credit group is made up of 8 women who live on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. This city is characterised by the natural beauty which surrounds it and its beautiful architecture. It has 4 rivers running through it and has been a World Heritage Site since December 1999. The members are very cheerful and with great charisma are always looking for a way to improve their household financial stability so they can make progress in life. 

One of the members of the group is Verónica, who is 27 years old and is married. From her marriage she has 2 children aged 5 and 2 and the older son is studying at a little school in the city. Her husband works as a public employee. They do not have their own house so they live in rented accommodation. Verónica spends most of her time looking after her children who are still small, but in order to contribute to the household finances she sells cosmetics. She works every day and has been doing this for 3 years. She also sells clothing through catalogues.

She will use the money from her loan to buy cosmetics and clothing in order to grow the business. Her goal is to travel and get to know other countries.

The small photo is of a member who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: La Industria El Rodeo Group

texts.es:
La señora Alma Delia es soltera. Tiene 39 años de edad. De escolaridad Secundaria Completa. Tiene 3 hijos y los 3 estan estudiando. Se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda en la escuela de la comunidad. Inició este negocio con un préstamo que adquirió y a la fecha lleva 8 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará pra la surtir su tienda de artículo de consumo diario. Espera en el futuro contar con un local propio y grande bien surtido.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio.
texts.en:
Alma Delia is 39 years old, is single and has completed her secondary education. She has 3 children and they are all studying. She works in business and has a shop in the community school. She started the business with a loan which she got and has 8 years' experience. 

Alma Delia is the organizer of a group and is asking for a loan which she will use to stock her shop with grocery staples. In the future she hopes to have a large, well-stocked place of her own.

The other members of the group work in business.

loans.use: to buy grocery staples.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is married with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister). She has a business of selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She has been in this business for six years selling to all categories of people on a retail basis. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She moves door-to-door selling used clothes seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include the rainy season, which hinders her movements, and thieves. She is aspiring to get a permanent business premises and also to start selling on a wholesale basis. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia fundadora del grupo de crédito La Merced, le gusta mucho este tipo de crédito ya que con sus amigas y compañeras comparten momentos gratos y poco a poco cumplen sus metas, vive en la parroquia Santa Ana en Cuenca, lugar que goza de un clima frió y se encuentra rodeada de varias montañas, desde su centro parroquial se puede observar la ciudad de Cuenca, la actividad económica de su gente es el comercio, crianza de animales y la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

Doña María tiene 52 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos mayores de edad, casados e independientes. Ella vive sola en su casa propia.
. 
La señora María trabaja de empleada domestica desde que era muy pequeña, gracias a este trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a toda su familia, en su hogar se dedica a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su hogar, también cría pollos para la venta. 

Con el dinero de su crédito va a comprar pollos y alimento para los mismos.

Su sueño es conservar su salud para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
María is a founder member of the La Merced credit group. She really likes this type of loan since she and her friends share good times together and gradually reach their goals. She lives in the parish of Santa Ana in Cuenca, a place which has a cold climate and is surrounded by several mountains. The city of Cuenca can be seen from her parish centre. The local people work in business, rearing animals and in agriculture and many work in the city doing various different jobs. 

María is 52 years old and is a single mother with 2 adult children who are married and independent. She lives alone in her own house. María has worked as a domestic help since she was very young and because of this work she has been able to bring all her family up. At home she works in agriculture for her household consumption and she also rears chickens to sell.

With the money from the loan she will buy chickens and chicken feed. She hopes to look after her health so she can carry on working.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Bancy

texts.en:
Bancy is 46 years old and married to John, a contractor. They are blessed with three children. Bancy has been selling clothes for the past ten years and makes approximately 10,000 KES a month.  She puts her profits into supporting the family. 

Bancy is applying for her third loan term with KADET after repaying her previous loans successfully. She will use a 100,000 KES loan to buy more clothes to sell. 

Bancy will pay the school fees for her children with her expected profits. She is working on expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Monkey Bush Traders Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Monkey Bush Traders” group from Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.
 
Issa is the featured leader of this group. The 40-year-old is married to a trader and they have two children. Issa sells used clothes and has been doing this business for many years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy a bale of used clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Zoila Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora Zoila es socia del grupo de crédito La Merced, vive en la parroquia Santa Ana en Cuenca, lugar que goza de un clima frió y se encuentra rodeada de varias montañas, también desde su centro parroquial se puede observar la ciudad de Cuenca, la actividad económica de su gente es el comercio, crianza de animales, la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

Doña Zoila tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 12 y 9 años que están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo su camioneta realizando fletes, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en la casa que es de su madre.

La Señora Zoila desde hace 4 años es propietaria de una tienda en la que trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y pollos. Estas actividades le dan la oportunidad de sacar en adelante a su familia.  
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su tienda. 

Su meta es de agrandar su tienda y llegar a tener un galpón de pollos más grande ya que desea criar 1500 pollos.
texts.en:
Zoila is a member of the La Merced credit group. She lives in the parish of Santa Ana in Cuenca, a place which has a cold climate and is surrounded by several mountains. The city of Cuenca can be seen from her parish centre. The local people work in business, rearing animals and in agriculture and many work in the city doing various different jobs.

Zoila is 37 years old and is married with 2 children aged 12 and 9 who are studying in a little school in the city. Her husband works as a driver and works with his van transporting freight. She does not have her own house so she lives in her mother's house.

For 4 years Zoila has owned a shop where she works from one Sunday to the next without a fixed timetable. She also rears pigs and chickens. These jobs give her the opportunity to bring her family up well.

She will use the money from the loan to buy supplies for her shop.  Her goal is to enlarge the shop and one day to have a larger poultry barn since she wants to rear 1500 chickens.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 34 years old and lives in Long Town with her husband and two children, ages 8 and 15, who are in school. She has been running a table where she sells red oil by the gallon in the local market. Ruth says she is able to send her children to school because of this business. She started by selling to her friends. 

Ruth is requesting a loan to buy more red oil by gallon for her business. Her plans are to expand her business even more and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more red oil by the gallon for her business.

loans.name: Munyika

texts.en:
Munyika is married and has nine children, seven of whom attend school and two who are adults. He lives at his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are household consumables and school fees.

For over three years, he has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women. He cites seasonality as his major challenge. He dreams of establishing a boutique in the near future.

With the KES 50,000, he wants to purchase cloth and sewing threads for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for his business.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del grupo de crédito La Merced, vive en la parroquia Santa Ana en Cuenca, lugar que goza de un clima frió y se encuentra rodeada de varias montañas, también desde su centro parroquial se puede observar la ciudad de Cuenca, la actividad económica de su gente es el comercio, crianza de animales, la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

Doña Rosa tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 20, 18, 14 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora en a área de la construcción, la casita donde vive es de su propia.
 
La señora Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y también a la cría de chanchos, pollos y vacas de las cuales vende la leche y también lo utiliza para su consumo, cuando tiene alguna necesidad sus animales los vende en su comunidad. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va  a invertir para la compra de alimento para animales, pollos y chanchos.

Su meta es tener más animales y de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the La Merced credit group. She lives in the parish of Santa Ana in Cuenca, a place which has a cold climate and is surrounded by several mountains. The city of Cuenca can be seen from her parish centre. The local people work in business, rearing animals and in agriculture and many work in the city doing various different jobs.

Rosa is 40 years old and is married with 4 children aged 20, 18, 14 and 9. The oldest two are working and help her financially, her third son is studying at college and the youngest son goes to a small school nearby.

Rosa's husband works in construction and the house they live in is their own. Rosa looks after the home and also rears pigs, chickens and cows from which she sells milk and also uses it for their own consumption. When she needs some money she sells some animals in her local community.

Rosa will use the money from the loan to buy animal feed, pigs and chickens. Her goal is to have more animals of better quality.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Valijon

texts.ru:
Валиджону 25 лет. Он работает в строительной бригаде. Их строительная бригада строит дома и делает ремонт в квартирах. Валиджону больше всего в этой работе нравится сам процесс работы. Его коллеги и по совместительству его лучшие друзья научили его этому делу, до сих пор помогают и поддерживают его. 
Валиджон берет кредит с целью приобрести шлифовальный аппарат для шлифовки пола. Аппарат придает гладкость поверхности, выравнивает все не ровности. Валиджон работает по части крыши, но он хочет преуспеть и к ремонту пола. В личной жизни Валиджон тоже преуспел не мало. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Валиджон надеется, что брав на себя дополнительную работу, он сможет получить дополнительный доход. И в будущем построит свой дом.
texts.en:
Valijon is 25 years old. He works on a construction team. Their team builds houses and does repairs in the apartments. Valijon likes the process in his job most of all. His coworkers are his best friends who taught him this business and still help and support him.

Valijon is taking out the loan with the goal to buy a sanding machine to sand floors. The machine makes the surfaces flat and evens out any bumps. Valijon works on the roofs, but wants to become more experienced repairing floors. In his personal life he has also achieved a lot. He is married and has two children. Valijon hopes that by taking additional work he will receive additional income. In the future he wants to build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase a sanding machine.

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.ru: Бывают такие профессии, которые требуют много времени и старания, порой  не хватает внимания для близких. Трудно приходится людям с такой профессией, если у них дом, семья, дети. Так же было трудно Абдукариму. Он работал дальнобойщиком, водил КАМАЗ. Абдукарим не хотел так долго расставаться с близкими людьми и перешел на другую работу. Теперь он работает просто водителем КАМАЗа, занимается перевозками в своем районе, доставляет горючие смеси и топливо. У Абдукарима остается много времени, и он не тратит его попросту. Дома у себя он занимается животноводством. Большая часть населения в Таджикистане занимается животноводством или растениеводством. Абдукарим надеется, что его труд принесет ему прибыл и за счет полученного дохода он сможет отремонтировать дом. Он берет кредит для закупа мелко - рогатого и крупнорогатого скота, коз, овец, двух коров и бычков.
texts.en: There are some professions that require a lot of time and hard work and sometimes there's not enough time left for the family. It's very hard for people with such professions if they have a home, family and children. It was also hard for Abdukarim. He worked as a truck driver driving Kamaz. Abdukarim did not want to separate from his loved ones for a long time and transferred to another job. Right now he works as just a Kamaz driver and transports freights in his region delivering fuel. Abdukarim has a lot of time left, but he does not waste it. He does animal husbandry at home. Most of the residents in Tajikistan do animal husbandry and field crop cultivation. Abdukarim hopes that his work will bring him profit and using that he will repair his home. He is taking out the loan to buy small horned and large horned cattle such as goats, sheep, two cows and calves.

loans.use: to buy and resell cattle.

loans.name: Matata

texts.en:
Matata lives and works outside of Mabokoni, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Matata is married, and has five children. His wife works as a businesswoman while he farms their land. He has been farming for 45 years, and is currently tending to an orange orchard. Matata is excited to become a beekeeper because it will give him access to fresh honey for home use. 

This is Matata's first loan, and he plans to use the income from his hives to pay school fees for his children. His hope for the future is to invest in his farm and improve his farm structure.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in a small town in Kwale county.  Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast and borders Tanzania to the south.  Inconsistent rainfalls make farming difficult and contribute to the area's high poverty rates. 

Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food, from the wild mangrove forest and local passion fruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area, but many farmers are very interested in owning hives. 

Christine is married, and she has two children. Her husband works as a teacher, while she farms their land and runs a small hair salon business. She is excited to start beekeeping because it will give her a source of home-made honey to eat. 

This is Christine's first loan, and she plans to use the income from her beehives to buy salon equipment. In the future, Christine hopes to expand her salon business, increasing her revenue base.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives and works in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost county in Kenya. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Samuel is married, and has five children. Both he and his wife work as farmers, and are currently growing passion fruit on their land. He is excited to start beekeeping because it will give him a source of natural honey for personal use. 

This is Samuel's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to build a rabbit pen. When asked about his hopes for the future, Samuel said he wanted "to treat coughs with honey."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Magodi, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and the large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Grace is married, and has five children. Both her and her husband farm, and are currently growing cassava and passion fruit on their land, the second of which makes an excellent food source for bees. Grace is excited to become a beekeeper because it will be a good source of income for household use. 

This is Grace's first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to increase her acreage of passion fruit. When asked about her hopes for the future, Grace replied that she wanted to be able to completely pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah lives in a small town outside of Ukunda in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average.

Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.

Veronicah is married and has four children. Both she and her husband have been farming for nine years and are currently growing mangoes on their land. Veronica is excited to start beekeeping because the bees do all the work and you don't have to worry about caring for them!

This is Veronicah's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to invest in dairy goats. Her hope for the future is to grow her beekeeping business enough "to establish commercial apiaries."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas lives in the town of Majoreni, in Kwale County, which is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Douglas is unmarried, and has been farming for four years. He is currently growing maize on his land, and he is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper, as this will give him fresh honey for household use and allow him to have another income stream.

This is Douglas' first loan, and he plans to use the income from his hives to invest in tools for his farm. His dream for the future is to grow his apiary, eventually expanding to 30 hives.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe lives on a small farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Wycliffe is married, and has two children. His wife works as an accountant, while Wycliffe farms their land. He is currently growing maize, beans, sunflower and bananas, as well as tending to livestock. Wycliffe started beekeeping because “honey is medicinal and bees are all over my house… if I can do beekeeping as a business then it will solve all these problems.”

This is Wycliffe’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to improve his dairy animals. Wycliffe’s hope for the future is “to be a model farmer in my county and maximize every opportunity.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Dora from Jui, which is in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with seven children between the ages of 1 and 25.  For more than 20 years, Dora has operated a food commodities business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that at present her business is doing well.
