Dora requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Dora plans to open a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is a 33-year-old married woman with three children who lives in Masindi, Uganda. She sells spare parts along a highway and the business has been very lucrative. She started the business so as to earn a living and her major customers are mechanics. She desires to educate her children up to the university level and set up a wholesale shop despite having inadequate capital. Jacqueline intends to use the loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   LAIDOU  est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies  dans le quartier   HEREMAKONO NORD  de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 9éme prêt. Les 8 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de fruits et légumes à l’image de KADIA qui est la femme assise dans la photo. Elle  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 20 régimes de bananes avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Laidou group consists of four married women who on average are 25 years old with three children. They live in traditional extended families in the North Heremakono neighborhood of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity so they can better manage their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their ninth loan. The eight previous loans have been fully repaid.

This group of women sells fruit and vegetables, like Kadia who is the woman sitting in front in the photo. She intends use the loan to buy 20 bunches of bananas from wholesalers in Bamako. She conducts her retail sales at the market and at home, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed primarily of women.

She expects an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs to be invested in the business and to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy bananas

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   SABALI  est constitué de 5 femmes  mariées et d’une veuve  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, et enfants dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 5éme prêt. Les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’  habillements à l’image de ROKIA qui  est la seule femme assise  dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 colis de friperies avec les commerçants de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sabali group consists of five married women and a widow who on average are 35 years old with six children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, and children in the North Heremakono neighborhood of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity so as to better manage their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their fifth loan. The previous four loans have been repaid in full.

This group of women trades clothing, like Rokia who is the only woman sitting in the photo. She intends to use the loan to buy two packages of used clothes from merchants in Bamako. She conducts her retail sales at the market and at home, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed primarily of women.

She expects average monthly profits of 55,000 CFA francs that will be reinvested in the business and also serve to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy used clothing

loans.name: Chilalu

texts.en:
Chilalu is married man with three children; two are in school and one is underage. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, he has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He mentioned seasonality as his major challenge. Chilalu dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000, he wants to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, sweets, biscuits, and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, sweets, biscuits, and cooking oil for his food stall business.

loans.name: Akpedji Group

texts.fr: AKPEDJI est un groupe de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Julienne Rufine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Julienne Rufine est âgée de 52 ans. Julienne Rufine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Julienne Rufine est veuve avec sept enfants, tous scolarisés et trois reste à sa charge. Julienne Rufine vend divers articles ( huile, sucre, savon, bombons etc) dans sa région depuis vingt cinq ans, ce qui lui permet de répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Julienne Rufine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires Julienne Rufine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AKPEDJI, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Akpedji is a group of three people who live in the same district. The representative of the group, whose name is Julienne Rufine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Julienne Rufine is 52 years old and attended school very little. She is a widow with seven children, all of whom are studying and three of whom remain her dependants. Julienne Rufine has been selling various products (oil, sugar, soap, candies, etc.) in her region for the past 25 years, and this enables her to provide for her family's needs. She gets her supplies in a Benin market. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase her turnover, Julienne Rufine is, together with the other members of the Akpedji group, requesting a fourth loan from Alidé. The previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy various products (oil, sugar, soap, candies, etc.)

loans.name: Marina Olga's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marina Olga est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo est âgée de 37 ans. Marina Olga a fréquenté l’école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Marina Olga est divorcée avec trois enfants, tous scolarisés et sa charge. Marina Olga vit ensemble ses enfants. Pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Marina Olga vend des produits cosmétiques depuis huit ans. Marina Olga s’approvisionne au Togo et au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son fond de roulement, Marina Olga ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe,sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group is made up of three people who live in the same district. It is the first time that the group has requested financial aid from Alidé, so that they can increase their business volume. The representative of the group, whose name is Marina Olga, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 37 years old and attended school until secondary level. She is divorced and has three children, all of whom are studying and her dependants. Marina Olga lives with her children. In order to be able to provide for her children's needs, she has been selling cosmetics for the past eight years. She gets her supplies in Togo. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase her working capital, Marina Olga is, together with the other members of the Akpedji group, requesting a first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda’s age is 30 years, she is a married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her whole family is fully dependent upon her husband. Her husband has only the single source of income. Her husband owns a workshop in which he provides services to paint and assemble the bodies of auto rickshaws. He removes the dents from the rickshaw’s body and paints for renewal. Mostly he paints the entire body of the depreciated rickshaw's for renewal.

His stock of paints has been finished and he does not have enough amount of money to buy paint for his services because he has already spent his savings upon the maintenance of his workshop.

Therefore, Rasheeda requested a loan for her husband so that her husband would be able to buy new cans of paint. Rasheeda, says thanks to all of our field officers.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of rickshaw for her husband's transportation business.

loans.name: Watta

texts.en: Watta is 30 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest producer of rubber in Liberia. She is single and has three children between the ages of 2 and 13. They all live at home, and two of them are in school. She stopped her education at 6th grade. She has been selling red oil, pepper, salt, and other items in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her friends and learned this trade from them. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, pepper, salt, and other items for her business. Her future plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, pepper, salt, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe fait partie d'un banc villageois créé le 15 décembre 2008.Il est composé de quatre femmes qui font le commerce comme principale activité.


Madame Coumba la représentante est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée, mère de cinq enfants. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de chaussures, sacs, écharpes et d'autres articles divers. Elle est debout à droite et a levé la main. 


Son crédit lui servira à diversifier son activité.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille pour l'alimentation et la scolarité.
texts.en:
This group is part of a "banc villageois" which was created on the 15th of December, 2008. It is made up of 4 women whose main business is retail.

Coumba, the group representative, is 56 years old. She is married and the mother of 5 children. She is a small retailer of shoes, bags, scarves and various other items. She is standing on the right of the picture and has her hand raised. This loan will help her to diversify her business. She uses her profits to cover her family's food and education expenses.

loans.use: to buy shoes and scarves for resale.

loans.name: Lura

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Lura from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children. For over 10 years, Lura has run her food commodities business. She established her business because she wants to empower herself and be independent. She works at the business for 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that at present her business is doing well.

Lura requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits, and sugar for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future Lura, plans to open a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits, and sugar for her retail activity.

loans.name: Zamiri Group

texts.fr: La cliente Musafiri est une président adjointe de l’association d’affaire « Zamiri » et mère de 5 enfants qui  étudient tous. Agée de 35 ans, la cliente est vendeuse de friperie au marché public. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle commença son commerce avec son fonds propre reçu de son époux. Grâce à cette entreprise, elle a réalisé plusieurs projets en faveur de sa famille et pour le développement de son entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt lui servira d'acheter 6 ballons de friperie. En plus, elle compte soutenir la scolarité de ses frères cadets, de ses enfants et construire une belle maison. Au finish, elle salut le programme Hekima pour son soutien et autonomisation des femmes non bancables surtout dans le contexte actuel de la guerre à l’Est de la République Démocratique du Congo où  l’économie est en décadence.
texts.en:
Musafiri is the assistant president of the borrowing group Zamiri. She is the mother of 5 children, all of whom attend school. She is 35 years old and a seller of used clothing at the public market. She has been in this business for 4 years. She began her business with her own funds received from her husband. Thanks to this business, she has been able to complete several projects for the benefit of her family and to further develop her business.

This new loan will allow her to purchase 6 bags of used clothing. In addition, she hopes to support her younger brothers' education, that of her own children, and an attractive home. In closing, she thanks the Hekima program for their support of self-sufficiency for women not eligible for traditional banking, especially in the current context of the war in the eastern Congo where the economy is in decline.

loans.use: to purchase 6 bags of used clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr:
Madame Anta est membre Banc Villageois depuis le 09 juillet 2011. Elle est une femme très dynamique et engagée dans les différentes activités collectives de son groupe.

Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Anta est âgée de 53 ans. Elle développe un petit commerce de riz local. Elle s'approvisionne dans la vallée pour revendre au marché central de sa ville.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte acheter une tonne de riz pour mieux développer son activité afin d'augmenter ses revenus.

Ses bénéfices sont recyclés dans son activité mais aussi lui permettent d'épargner en vue d'atteindre une autonomie financière.
texts.en: Anta has been a member of the "banc villageois" since the 9th of July, 2011. She is a very dynamic woman who is very involved in the different collective activities of her group. She is married and the mother of 5 children. She is 53 years old. She is developing a small business selling local rice. She gets her supplies in the valley and resells them at her town's central market. With her new loan, she plans to buy a ton of rice so that she can better develop her business and increase her revenues. Her profits are reinvested into her business but also enable her to build up savings, with the aim of becoming financially independent.

loans.use: to buy local rice for resale.

loans.name: Médékokou Dénis

texts.fr: Médékokou Dénis est âgé de 39 ans et vit au Bénin. Médékokou Dénis a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Médékokou Dénis est marié à une coiffeuse nommée Madeleine. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Médékokou Dénis vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour ce faire Médékokou Dénis vend depuis dix sept des boissons dans sa région. Médékokou Dénis s'approvisionne dans sa région. Pour satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Médékokou Dénis sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Médékokou Dénis is 39 years old and lives in Benin. He left school at secondary level. He is married to a hairdresser called Madeleine. The couple have 3 children, some of whom attend school. Médékokou Dénis lives together with his wife and children. The couple both take care of the various household expenses. In order to be able to do this, Médékokou Dénis has been selling drinks locally for 17 years. He gets his supplies in the area. In order to be able to satisfy the needs of his growing clientèle, Médékokou Dénis is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan has been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Sharifamo

texts.ru: Шарифамо 41 год. Она домохозяйка. Шарифамо умеет шить. Она шьет только для себя и для детей. Свою дочь она научила такому ремеслу. Платье, которое на ней она тоже сама сшила. Теперь Шарифамо хочет воспользоваться своим талантом и купить профессиональную швейную машинку на сумму от кредита, чтобы брать заказы на шитье национальных платьев. Ее муж работает бухгалтером в автошколе. Дети целый день в школе. У Шарифамо много времени, чтобы у себя дома брать заказы на шитье и в дальнейшем развить свой маленький бизнес.
texts.en: Sharifamo is 41 years old. She is a homemaker. Sharifamo knows how to sew. She sews only for herself and her children. She has taught her daughter this trade. The dress that she is wearing in the picture is one that she has made herself. Now Sharifamo wants to make use of her talent. She wants to buy a professional sewing machine with a loan so that she can take orders for making national dresses. Her husband works as an accountant in a driving school. Her children spend all day at school. Sharifamo has a lot of time, so she can take sewing orders at home and develop her small business in the future.

loans.use: Для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы начать свое дело и улучшить жизненные условия

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.ru:
Мухаммадчон после окончания колледжа сразу женился. Он имеет среднетехническое образование. Мухаммадчон женат, у него две дочки и сын. Ему 31 год. Когда Мухаммадчон был маленьким его отец имел большую стаду коров, но теперь он сед и стар. Коров тоже нет. Мухаммадчон хочет, как отец собрать свою стаду и начать собственный бизнес по купли и продажи домашних скотов. У него уже есть коровник и сено, осталось только купить коров. Он берет кредит для закупа двух коров. В этом труде ему будет помогать его жена, и делиться своим опытом, отец. Надеемся, что у него все получиться. 
Мухаммадчон ждет вашей поддержки.
texts.en: Muhammadjon got married right after graduating from college. He has a secondary technical education. Muhammadjon is married and has two daughters and a son. He is 31 years old. When Muhammadjon was little, his father had a big herd of cattle, but now his father is old and gray and no longer has cattle. Muhammadjon wants to put together his own herd like his father and start his own business buying and selling cattle. He already had a cow barn and hay, all he has left to do is buy cattle. He is taking out a loan to buy two cows. His wife will be able to help him with this business and his father with be able to share his experience with him. We hope that he receives what he is asking for. Muhammadjon awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cows to put together a herd and start his own business buying and selling cattle.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida is a 37-year-old hardworking housewife. She is the mother of four children. 

Her husband owns a vegetable shop that is the only source of income for his family. He purchases a variety of fresh and seasonal vegetables from the field and sells them in the main market.
 
Now he hired a shop for selling vegetables, and he needs to purchase vegetables for his shop. For that his wife, Abida, has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase vegetables. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to increase his net income. Abida will save the profit amount for future needs or medical expenses of her children. 

Abida prays for the success of her husband’s business. She is feeling relaxed and happy after taking the loan.
 
Abida says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

Note: Abida raises her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fresh and seasonal vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Рустам проживает в районе Яван. Ему 48 лет. Он женатый мужчина. У него четверо детей, двое сыновей, которым 10 и 19 лет и дочери 16 и 20 лет. Его жена и дочери домохозяйки, а сыновья учатся. Сам Рустам на протяжении двенадцати лет работает поваром в национальной кухни. Он в основном готовит вкусный таджикский плов. В свободное от работы время Рустам решил заняться животноводством, совместив работу повара. Идею по совмещению двух работ подкинул его брат, который несколько лет занимается купле - продажей домашних животных. Он будет первое время помогать Рустаму, чтобы Рустам смог с легкостью начать свой бизнес. 
Рустам берет кредит для закупа двух телят, трех коров и бычка с целью начать разводить скот у себя дома.
texts.en: Rustam lives in Yavan district. He is 48 years old. He is a married man. He has four children: two sons who are 10 and 19 years old and two daughters who are 16 and 20 years old. His wife and daughters are homemakers and his sons go to school. For twelve years, Rustam has worked as a cook preparing ethnic dishes. He mainly cooks delicious Tajik plov (a Central Asian rice dish). In his free time off from work, Rustam decided to start doing animal husbandry, along with his job as a chef. The idea for two simultaneous jobs came from his brother, who has bought and sold livestock for several years now. He will help Rustam in the beginning, so that Rustam can easily start his own business. Rustam is taking out a loan to buy two calves, three cows and a bull-calf in order to start raising cattle at home.

loans.use: To buy two calves, three cows and a bull-calf in order to start raising cattle at home.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan of KES 40,000 to buy more goats for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more goats for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Meet 44-year-old Mary from Jui in the eastern area of Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children between the ages of 6 and 24 years. 

More than 10 years ago, Mary established her food commodities business. She began her business because she wants to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that at present her business is doing well.

Mary requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Mary plans to open a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en:
Jannet is 39 years old and lives in Logan Town. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have five children between the ages of 3 to 20, two of whom attend school.

Jannet has been operating a shop for the past five years where she sells charcoal. She says sometimes she experiences loses but not all of the time.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She hopes to extend her business into other local markets and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a widowed woman who has been blessed with five children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Kwekwe has operated a charcoal selling business for the last ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon lives in the Cherengani area, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Solomon is married and has two children. Both he and his wife work as teachers, with Solomon teaching at a local primary school. Solomon also farms his land and grows maize, beans and bananas as well as trees on his plot. 

This is Solomon’s first loan with Kiva, and he is grateful for this opportunity to own hives for honey production. Solomon hopes to learn from this experience and educate his pupils on the importance of beekeeping, since, as an agriculture teacher, he understands very well their role in the ecosystem.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Bintu

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Bintu from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has three children between the ages of 9 years and 12 years.  In 2000, Bintu established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wanted to generate her own source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is sometimes the vehicle breaks down on the way. 

Bintu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Bintu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama is 50 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest production rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married and has six children between 10 and 34 years old. Five attend school. She was not fortunate to attend school.

She has been selling red oil, cold water, and pepper in the local market for four years. She started this business when she thought of being able to do something for herself, and she learned this trade from friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, cold water, and pepper for her business. Her future plan is to educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, cold water, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Yesu Anaweza Group

texts.fr: Agée de 42ans, la cliente Muhindo est membre du groupe de crédit « Yesu anaweza ». Elle est mère de 5 enfants qui étudient tous. Son mari est fonctionnaire de l’Etat. C’est depuis 7 ans qu’elle est couturière et c’est par le biais de sa mère qu’elle a pu commencer cette activité. En cela, le nouveau prêt lui servira à acheter les matériels de couture dont le ruban, 3 rouleaux de tissus, le fil, des aiguilles, des ciseaux. Elle fait face à différents problème dont celui de clients qui ne retirent pas les habits à temps. Avec le bénéfice de la couture elle voudrait accroitre l’activité et ainsi acheter une parcelle. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien financier aux personnes pauvres. Il sied de signaler que certaine clientes portent leurs bébés
texts.en:
Muhindo, age 42, is a member of the loan group “Yesu Anawesa”. She has five children who all go to school, and her husband is a government employee. 

She became a seamstress seven years ago, an activity she started with her mother’s help. This new loan will allow her to buy sewing notions including ribbon, thread, needles, scissors, and 3 bolts of fabric. She faces various problems such as customers taking too long to pick up their item.  

She would like to use the profits earned through her sewing activity to expand her business and to buy some land. 

Muhindo wishes to thank Hekima for its financial support to the poor.  

It should be noted that some of the group members are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy sewing notions including ribbon, thread, needles, scissors, and three bolts of fabric.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with five children. She has operated a kerosene selling business for the past three years. She cites transportation costs as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 39 years old and married, with two children between the ages 12 years and 18 years. She runs a palm oil business in Waterloo, a western, rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to make her daily living. 

She's been in this business since 2008 and she sells palm oil and coconut oil within a busy market area. She says that, at present, her business is doing well because, out of the profit, she was able to take care of her family.

Mariama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited to purchase palm oil, beans, and brooms for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and roof her house for the rainy season. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, beans, and brooms for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. She has two children and she has been farming for six years. Her primary income sources are eggs, crops, transportation services, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Selling her farm produce." Her biggest challenge is: "Marketing the produce due to unstable prices." Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Cecilia was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "To benefit from their loans."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "Savings found is the foundation of group lending."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked: "How will this loan benefit her family?," Cecilia replied: "Will be able educate her children."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Cecilia owns the following: 'poultry and a motorcycle,' but she does not own: 'a cow, pig, pump, bicycle or automobile.' 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net, solar power, running water, TV, and DVD,' but she does not have" 'electricity or a sewing machine.'

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Here is 42-year-old Christiana, from Liberia. She lives in Logan Town area. She is married to a local businessman and they  have seven children, ages between seven and 26. Only three of the children are attending school and live at home. 

Christiana has been operating a shop for the past five years now where she sells charcoal by the bag in her community market. She has little capital that she operates her business with. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal by the bag for her business. She plans to build a house for her children and to educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Jesudegbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupement JESUDEGBE est composé de dix huit personnes qui sont des amies et font des tontines ensemble. La représentante de ce groupement, nommée Justine(est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 34 ans. Justine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Justine est mariée à un marçon du nom de Augustin. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et à leur charge.  Justine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. C’est pour cette raison que depuis douze ans, Justine vend du riz dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Justine vend du maïs. Justine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans d’accroitre le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Justine ensemble avec les autres membres du JESUDEGBE sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The JESUDEGBE group consists of 18 members who are friends that participate in savings groups together. The group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé for the first time to bolster their activity and meet customer demand. 

The group’s representative is Justine, age 34, seen with a hand raised in the photo. Justine never received any schooling. She is married to a mason named Augustin, and the couple have three children, some of them in their care and attending school. Justine lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. To that end, Justine has been selling rice locally for the past 12 years. She also sells maize. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

To improve her activity and achieve customer satisfaction, Justine is seeking this loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the JESUDEGBE group.

loans.use: to buy rice and maize.

loans.name: Nelson Emilio

texts.es: Nelson, con 41 años de edad, es padre de un hijo de 7 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja sentimental. Hace 19 años tuvo que radicarse en la ciudad, víctima del desplazamiento forzado por la violencia que se presentó en el pueblo donde vivía, dejando atrás todo lo que había construido, su finca y sus cultivos de café, viéndose obligado a comenzar desde cero. Comenzó a trabajar en propiedad raíz, generando inversiones por las cuales recibía comisión, pero ahora desea iniciar su propio negocio y generar ingresos por cuenta propia. Su proyecto consiste en montar un almacén de remates o miscelánea donde pueda ofrecer diversidad de productos de papelería, accesorios de bisutería, artículos de aseo entre otros, para esto ya tiene el local ubicado en una esquina y ha ido investigando a los que serían sus posibles proveedores. El cliente es pujante, emprendedor, tiene visión y se proyecta hacia el cumplimiento de sus metas. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (lapiceros, cuadernos, cosméticos, artículos de aseo, entre otros) y 2 vitrinas para almacenar sus productos; de esta manera podrá dar inicio a su proyecto de negocio, con el cual espera generar los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia, sacar adelante su hijo y en un futuro cercano poder brindar mejor calidad de vida y bienestar a todos los integrantes de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Nelson, who is 41 years old, is the father of a 7-year-old boy and lives in a common law marriage with his partner. Nineteen years ago, he had to move to the city because he was a victim of forced displacement due to the violence that occurred in the village where he had been living. He had to leave behind everything that he had built, including his farm and coffee crops, and start over from nothing.

He began working in real property, making investments for which he earned a commission, but now he would like to start his own business and generate income for himself. His project consists of establishing a store selling miscellaneous goods, which will offer a variety of products like paper goods, jewelry, cleaning products, and other things. He already has a property located on a corner and he has been researching possible suppliers.

Nelson is a thriving entrepreneur who has vision and works towards achieving his goals. He request the support of this loan to purchase merchandise in bulk (pens, notebooks, cosmetics, cleaning products, etc.) and 2 display cabinets on which to store his products. This way, he will be able to begin his business project, which he hopes will generate the income necessary to provide his family with the basic necessities, bring his son forward in life, and provide a better quality of life and well-being to his immediate family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in bulk (pens, notebooks, cosmetics, cleaning products, etc.) and 2 display cabinets on which to store his products.

loans.name: Deyner

texts.es: Deyner habita en un municipio, área metropolitana de Barranquilla; allí se dedica a la venta de cerdo y carnero desde hace 1 año, cuando su tío le propuso este negocio, para lo cual debe viajar a un pueblo cercano y traerlo al municipio de Soledad, para distribuirlos entre consumidores, pues logra obtener buenos precios que le permiten sostenerse en el mercado.  Sus ventas las hace semanalmente a crédito y así mismo maneja la frecuencia de sus compras,  las que hace de contado.  Su meta es aumentar su capital de trabajo, para vender más y más adelante adquirir su propia vivienda. Su mayor desafío es lograr sostenerse con buenos precios y para ello acude  a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará carne de cerdo y carnero en un mayor volumen apuntándole a obtener muchos mejores precios y esto es lo que hace exitosa su inversión.
texts.en:
Deyner lives in a municipality of the metropolitan area of Barranquilla. He has been selling pork and mutton for the past year. His uncle suggested this business in which he must travel to a nearby city and transport it to the municipality of Soledad for distribution to the public. He was able to sell at good prices which allowed him to continue in the market. He sells once a week on credit, in this way managing the frequency of his purchases, which are in cash.

His goal is to increase his working capital, sell more and more and eventually buy his own home. His biggest challenge is to continue selling at good prices. For this reason he has requested a loan from Kiva, which is his first loan he has made through la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Deyner will use it to buy pork and mutton in greater volume, aiming to get much better prices which would make this investment successful.

loans.use: to buy pork and mutton in greater volume.

loans.name: Arcelis

texts.es: Aracelis fue apoyada por Kiva en su negocio de Modistería y venta de queso, su negocio tiene muchos mas clientes pues logró con la metería prima que compró (telas hilos, etc.) realizar trabajos de confección que tenia pendientes y responder a los pedidos de queso de sus clientes, negocio que representa un ingreso adicional. Aracelis dice a Kiva que con su ayuda en sus actividades, Hoy muchos mas clientes conocen de su negocio y con las utilidades está poco a poco terminando su vivienda, para vivir cómodamente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, mediante el cual invertirá en queso y carne de cerdo, además no deja sus actividades de arreglo de ropa, por eso también invertirá en insumos de confección.
texts.en: Arcelis was helped by Kiva in her sewing and cheese selling businesses. She has many more customers because with the raw materials she bought (fabric, thread, etc.) she was able to do work she had on order and fill her customers' cheese orders, which are additional income. Arcelis tells Kiva that with its help in he activities, a lot more customers know about her business now and with the profits she is finishing her home little by little so she can live comfortably. Right now she is applying for a new loan with which she will in vest in cheese and pork. She also will not abandon her work repairing clothing and that is why she will also invest in sewing materials.

loans.use: to invest in sewing materials, cheese and pork.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Isatu, from Waterloo2, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with six children between the ages of 18 years and 30 years.  

In 2005, Isatu established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wanted to improve the lives of her family. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil and native rice, to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Isatu plans to further expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil and native rice, to expand her business.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is 44 years old and lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is married and has five children between the ages of 7 and 25. Her children are presently in school and live at home. 

For the past six years, Dorris has been running a shop where she sells charcoal in the local market. She started this business with money from her husband. With this little money, she managed to established her business and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She is very happy with her business because she makes a lot of profit and it keeps her busy. 

Dorris is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build a house and further improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Emma, from Waterloo2, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with one child.  

In 2000, Emma established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Emma requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Emma plans to further expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Carlos Gerardo

texts.es: Carlos Gerardo, tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y hermanos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijol que tenga una alta geminación y se adapte bien a la zona y con una alto desarrollo, fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Carlos Gerardo is 18 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings, who are his main priority. With his loan, he intends to buy bean seeds  with high germination that adapt well to the area with good growth, as well as fertilizer and other products for the crop. He will also pay for labor costs to apply the products and help once there is growth. This way, he can make sure it is done well. What he intends to do is take advantage of the good weather and soil conditions in the area for this crop. He also wants to put into practice his several years of experience managing basic grains. In addition, he wants to be able to buy the best products of the best quality for his farm to have good growth and health as well as a good crop and have an important yield in the short term. With the income from the harvest he hopes to obtain, he wants to obtain well being and education for his family and achieve some family goals and keep investing in his crops. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had any loans before with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan on better terms and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Yolan

texts.es: Yolan, tiene la edad  de 35 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y su hija los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de frijol de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Yolan is 35 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and daughter, who are his main priority. With the loan, he intends to buy fertilizer and other product to apply to the crop so he can have good germination, as well as good quality bean seeds. He will also pay for labor costs to apply the products and help with the crop once it has some growth and in this way ensure good work. He intends on taking advantage of the good weather and soil conditions the area has for this crop, and also put into practice his years of experience managing basic grains. He also wants to buy the best products of the best quality so his farm will have good growth and a good harvest and an important yield in the short term. With the income from the harvest he hopes to obtain the well being and education for his family and meet some family goals and keep investing more in the crops. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had any loans before with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 51 years old and married. She has been successfully running chop bar (local restaurant) for nine years at the corner of her house. She offers  varieties of cook local food like kenkey (cooked maize paste) and fish, banku (cooked maize and cassava paste) and soup, and fufu (process cassava and plantain) and soup. She sells enough to provide for her family. 

Grace is requesting a loan for 1,200 GHS, which she will use to buy ingredients such as cassava, plantain, corn dough, and vegetables.  She will use these items to prepare good and healthy food to sell to her customers and meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as cassava, plantain, corn dough, and vegetables

loans.name: Mwanasiri

texts.en:
Mwanasiri is married. She does not have children, but she stays with her deceased sister's children. They live in their own house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the adopted children. 

Mwanasiri has operated a khanga-selling business (women's wrap cloth), selling from home and door-to-door, to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of a lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, Mwanasiri wants to purchase two bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of khangas for resale.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a clothes store where she sells clothes. She describes her family challenge to be the lack of a tank to store enough water. 

She will use the KES 22,000 loan to buy a 3,000-liter water tank. This will enable her family to store enough clean water for domestic use.

Peninah hopes that, in the future, she will economically grow and sustain her family. This is Peninah's fourth loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Previous loans were successfully paid.

loans.use: to buy a 3,000-liter water tank.

loans.name: Take Courage Group

texts.en:
The “Take Courage” group consists of small scale businesspeople based in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting for a loan of 4,000,0000 SLL in order to expand their respective businesses. 

The featured leader of this group is Mariama who is 30 years old, married, and has three children who attend school.  She was born in Kabala town, in northern Sierra Leone but now lives in Waterloo. Mariama’s husband is a businessman. She sells onions, tomatoes, etc., which she has been doing for many years. With her share of this loan, she is will to buy onions, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 42 years old and married, the mother of five children.  

She has run a small general store in her community for many years, with the support of her husband. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices, and she has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To stock her store more fully, Naseem has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 that she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Naseem wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour at lower rates.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman, with six children, three of whom are in school and the rest are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. Chizi dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 47 years old and married, the father of five children, living in Aden, Yemen. 

Ahmed`s business is a grocery store that he started three years ago with limited capital and income. He knows how to attract customers through the service he provides and the prices he offers. His main customers are homemakers living in his neighborhood and the local community. So he is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses. 

Being an ambitious man, he would like to expand his business to provide for his clients' needs and get more profit. So he took a youth loan of YER 200,000 from AMB to purchase grocery goods for his business. 

In the future, he hopes to expand his business to offer a good life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods for his business.

loans.name: Mayosi Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Mayosi” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of 4,000,000 SLL in order to add more inventory to their respective businesses. 

The featured leader of this group is Fatmata. Fatmata is 41 years old. She was born in Matotoka village, in northern Sierra Leone, but she is currently residing in Waterloo with her husband and one child. Her husband is a businessman and her child is attending secondary school. For eight years now,  Fatmata has been selling market food: palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, tomatoes, etc. With this loan, she is going to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, tomatoes, etc., at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, tomatoes, etc., at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en: Jalia is a single mother of five children; three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a business of selling food items, such as bunches of bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava and Irish potatoes, and has been in this business for ten years. She works at the market seven days every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to go to villages for food items and also to start growing some of those food items. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava and Irish potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es:
José desde que habitaba  en la finca de sus padres y en tiempo de cosecha,  salía a vender el producido por la tierra, así inició su experiencia de ventas y desde hace 14 años emprendió su negocio de venta de yuca, viajando a comprar en el pueblo pues hoy habita en un sector urbano.   
José tiene sus principales clientes en el sector donde habita y son principalmente tiendas y vecinos cercanos alrededor de su barrio, su casa se ha convertido en un punto comercial reconocido, pero también vende puerta a puerta todos los días, de contado desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y de lunes a domingos. Su meta es incrementar sus ventas y tener su propia vivienda mas adelante, pues su mayor desafió es la competencia de precios y por eso el requiere comprar en un mayor volumen. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  yuca y aguacate, para aumentar sus inventarios de productos que ofrecer e incrementar sus ventas con el fin de lograr, poco a poco sus sueños de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Since he used to reside on his parents' farm, Jose has been selling the land's produce at harvest time. Thus began his sales experience and for the last 14 years he has been in the business of selling maniac. Now he travels to trade in the village, since at  present, he lives in the urban sector.  

Jose has his principal customers in the zone where he lives, and these are mainly stores and nearby neighbors from his barrio. Jose's residence has become a recognized point of commerce. In addition, he makes cash sales, door to door every day, from 7:00 am until 7:00 pm, Monday to Sunday. 

Jose's goal is to increase sales and have his own home in the future. His main challenge is the price competition, and for that reason he needs to purchase a larger volume. That's why Jose is requesting a Kiva loan, his first request through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With these funds, he will buy maniac and avocados and expand his inventory of products on offer, hoping to increase his sales and achieve, little by little, his dream of prosperity.

loans.use: to purchase maniac and avocados to sell.

loans.name: Las Flores Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
La señora Leslie Liseth es unida de hecho. Tiene 24 años de edad. No tuvo a oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 1 hijo que aún no estudia. Se dedica a atender su tienda de artículos de consumo diario. Inició este negocio con un pequeño capital y a la fecha lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de artículos de consumo diario como: azucar, granos básicos, detergentes, embutidos, entre otros. Desea en el futuro tener una abarrotería.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales, comercio y agricultura.

En la fotografia se ven 7 integrantes pero solo a 6 de ellas se le concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Leslie Liseth is 24 years old. She is in a common-law relationship and has one child who does not yet go to school. Leslie Liseth did not have the opportunity to study. She takes care of her store where she sells basic food and household products. She started this business with very little capital and has had three years of experience up to this point.

Leslie Liseth organized a group and is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase daily use items like sugar, basic grains, detergents, sausages etc. In the future she would like to own a grocery store. 

The other members of the group raise animals, do business and are involved in agriculture. Seven people appear in the picture. Only six of them are involved in the loan.

loans.use: to buy daily use items.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Meet 20-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo2 in Freetown's eastern area. She is single and the mother of one child who is two years old. In 2011, she went into the business of selling slippers as a way to support her child. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that her main challenge is insufficient capital, and is requesting this loan to buy more slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will also allow her to improve her living conditions. In the future, she plans to open a store where she can sell her slippers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Isatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is single with no children for now. She began her business because she wanted to create her own income source to take care of her parents. In 2008, Isatu established her general store business. She works at the business from 8am to 12pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items, like cigarettes, biscuits, juice and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Isatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items, like cigarettes, biscuits, juice and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Makhmad

texts.en: Makhmad is a 25-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, son, parents, brother and sister-in-law in a small village in Kaspi district. The family runs a husbandry business. In particular, they have six cows. Makhmad's mother milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell. Along with this business, Makhmad decided to start a business buying and selling cows. He requested a loan of $4,300 to purchase cows. The Start Up program, a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, gives him a chance to obtain a business loan. Makhmad will purchase cows from wholesalers and then resell at a higher price. This will increase the income of his family. With increased income, he will provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to begin buying and selling cows.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, age 39, is from Liberia and lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. Sarah is single and has three children between the ages of 11 and 23. Two are presently in school and live at home. She was unfortunate only to have completed second grade. 

Sarah started her business with a small amount of money given to her as a credit from her uncle's wife and she managed to turn it into a larger amount. She learned the business from other local business people. She is very happy with her business because she makes a lot of profits and it provides money for her expenses. She is proud of her business because it makes her popular. She described herself as ha ard working businesswoman. 

Sarah has requested a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plan is to build a decent house for her children. She thanks the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Ntembe

texts.en:
Ntembe is a married woman with five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for the children.

Ntembe sells dumplings from home to the general public. She faces major challenges of seasonality in her business and lack of enough capital for the continuity of the business.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Moday

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Moday, who is from Waterloo 2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with six children between the ages of 6 years and 22 years.  

In 2000, Moday established her slippers business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself and her family.   She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Moday requires a loan in order to purchase more slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Moday plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 42 years old and lives in Logan Town, well known as one of the earliest communities in Liberia. She is unmarried and has three children between the ages of 12 and 18, all presently in school and living at home.  Jessie stopped her education at the tenth grade. 

For the past six years, she has been running a shop where she sells cosmetics, biscuits, etc.  She started this business with a little money from her susu (daily local saving) and learned this way of selling from her friends.  She likes her business because she makes a lot of profits, and it keeps her busy.

Jessie is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics, biscuits, etc., for her business.  Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, biscuits, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 30 years old and married, the mother of seven children. Her husband's income is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of the Kashf Foundation, Sakina has gradually improved her business.  Currently she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. 

This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en: Rafia is 33 years old and married. She has been running a business of stitching clothes for the past five years. Rafia is the mother of three children. She started her business on a small scale in her community to generate income to support her family, especially to pay for the education of her children. She stitches clothes with the latest designs and provides good service to her clients. She has attained a good number of customers. Currently, she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons and lace. In this way, she will be able to meet with the increasing demand of her customers without delay. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons and lace.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 47-year-old married woman and has been running her business of stitching cloths for the past five years. She started her business on a small scale in her community to generate income to support her family, especially for the education of her children. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue the operations of her business, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy stock of thread in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons to meet increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock of thread in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 41 years old and a married woman who has been running a small general store for a period of about three years to meet her family's expenses. She is a mother of six children and she is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing, and health. 

Shamim wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy packs of oil, biscuits, and beverages, to meet the increasing demand at her store. 

It's Shamim's second year with Kashf Foundation and she has shown good repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of oil, biscuits, and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 47 years old and married.  She operates her own business of cloth sales to support her husband financially in meeting their household expenses. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and sells them to the people in her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.  

Naseem is requesting a loan from Kashf Foundation for 25,000 PKR, which she will use to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Naseem expects a boost in her earnings with this loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en: Farhat is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making artificial jewelery for many years. The business has great potential for growth. Farhat is actively helping her husband financially, as this business is the only source of income for them. She has six children and is motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. In order to meet the orders on time and boost her sales, Farhat requested a loan of 15,000 PKR to purchase raw materials such as silver, gold, and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to increase her net income and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as silver, gold, and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is 43 years old, married and the mother of six children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failed, and decided to initiate her own business to support her family and give it a better future. Three years ago she opened a general store in a corner of her house. She has become famous for providing good-quality products to people in her area. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for Rs 20,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of rice, flour and sugar. In this way she would be able to consistently meet this increasing demand. She is in her 8th loan cycle and has a good credit history. She wants to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy supplies of rice, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a 59-year-old married man from a small village near Jenin City. He is the father of a son and a daughter. Sameer works on a small bus where he transfers children from their kindergarten. Also, he buys some products like clothes and sells them to the local traders in the city. It is a profitable job but he needs some money to buy more products. 

Sameer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products, especially clothes, and resell them to the local traders. This loan will improve his business and also his income. 
Sameer appears in the photo in his store where he keeps the stocks

loans.use: to buy more products, especially clothes, and resell them to the local traders

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 24-year-old married man from Qalqilya city. He lives in a very old house where his family used to live. Ibrahim is a worker in a local aluminum factory in the city. He earns a low wage and it is the only source of income for the family. Ibrahim would like to improve his family's living conditions, but he does not have enough money.

Ibrahim took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to repair the family home, especially the paint and changing the doors. This will improve the family's living conditions. 

Ibrahim appears in the photo.

loans.use: to repair the family home, especially the paint and changing the doors

loans.name: Sayyohidin

texts.ru: Сайёхидин простой фермер. Он проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 31 год. Сайёхидин занимается растениеводством 17 лет. На своей земле он сажает лук и пшеницу. Ему помогает его жена, дети тоже хотят помочь отцу, но они маленькие. Сайёхидин отец четверых детей, а также он преподает в средней школе. Он с женой старательно готовится к осеннему посеву. И кредит берет для приобретения семян лука и пшеничных зерен. Сайёхидин настойчиво готовиться, и надеется, что в следующем году получит богатый урожай. Больше всего ему нравятся то что он получит честный заработок нажитым своими руками своим трудом. Сайёхидин жизнерадостный и честный человек. Надеемся, он воспитает своих детей такими же.
texts.en:
Sayyohidin is a simple farmer. He is 31 years old and lives in Shahrituz, Tajikistan. Sayyohidin has been growing crops since he was 17 years old. He plants onion and wheat on his land. His wife helps him, but his children, although they want to help, are too young. Sayohhidin has four children and teaches at a high school.

Sayyohidin and his wife are working hard to prepare for autumn planting. The loan will allow them to buy onion and wheat seeds. Sayyohidin is working diligently, and hopes that next year will bring a plentiful harvest. Most of all, he likes that he will earn his living honestly and through his own effort. Sayyohidin is a happy and honest person; we hope that he will raise his children to be the same way.

loans.use: to buy onion and wheat seed.

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Hassani, who is in his early 40s, is divorced and staying with his three girls, all of whom are in school. For eight years now, Hassani has been managing his life by running two businesses: a food shop (selling rice, flour, beans, sugar, cooking oil etc.) and a concrete business. He is doing fine with his family and businesses. He starts working from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to restock his food shop. Hassani dreams that one day will be able to improve his food business by being able to produce all crops himself.
 
He will share this loan with his loan group, Ujamaa, which consists of nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock his food shop.

loans.name: Tufaidi Group

texts.en:
Zana, who is in her early thirties, is single.  She has been running a pharmacy business since 2009.  She works from 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Zana's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan to buy more medicines and to expand the pharmacy shop to two rooms instead of one room.  She dreams of opening a another pharmacy in a different place.

Zana will share this loan with her Tufaidi loan group,  which has twelve members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more medicines and to expand the pharmacy shop to two rooms instead of one room.

loans.name: Ruth Noemi

texts.es:
La  señora Ruth de 56 años, vive con sus hijos  en su casa de habitación ubicada en un barrio de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 20 años a la elaboración y venta de vestidos, pantalones de mujer, pantalones de hombre, trajes de señora, etc. 
Doña Ruth su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación y sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que el visitan de diferentes barrios de donde vive, le prefieren por su buena atención y por su buen trabajo.
Doña Ruth está solicitando  el préstamo para compra de telas, hilos, agujas de máquina y adornos para sus diferentes diseños que hace en la sastrería, ya que tiene varios  encargos de vestidos que entregar y necesita variedad de telas. Está muy contenta de trabajar con Prisma ya que con la ayuda de los préstamos que se le han brindado a podido ampliar su negocio.
Doña Ruth su sueño ampliar su negocio.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre  del 2013.
texts.en:
Ruth, 56, lives with her children in her house located in a neighborhood in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  For the last 20 years she’s worked making and selling dresses, women’s slacks, men’s trousers, women’s suits, etc.  Ruth’s business is located at home and her customers are neighbors and friends that visit her from the various neighborhoods they live in.  They prefer her because of the good service and her  good work.

Ruth is asking for the loan to buy fabric, thread, machine needles and decorations for her various designs since she does tailoring and has several dresses on order she needs to deliver; she needs a variety of fabrics.  

She’s very happy to work with Prisma because she’s been able to expand the business with help from the loans.  Her dream is to expand the business.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - September, 2013.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: La Barranca Group

texts.es:
La señora Nelida Emilsa es de estado civil casada. Cuenta con 33 años de edad. De escolaridad primaria completa.
Tiene 2 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando. Se dedica al a comprar y vender ponchos y chamarras de tapachula. Inició este negocio con un préstamo que le concedieron y a la fecha lleva 12 años de expericnecia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de chamarras y ponchos para revenderlos. Desea en el futuro ser una proveedora reconocida y poder vender por mayor.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y actividades agropecuarias.

Una de las socias no pudo asistir cuando tomaron la foto.
texts.en:
Nélida Emilsa, 33, is married and completed primary school.  She has two children one of which attends school.  She works buying and selling jackets and ponchos from Tapachula.  She started the business with a  loan she was granted and to date has 12 years’ experience.  She can count on her husband’s support; he’s a merchant.

She organized a group and requested a loan she’ll use to buy jackets and ponchos to resell.  She hopes in future to become a well-known supplier and to be able to sell at wholesale..

The other group members work in commerce and in agriculture.  One of the members was unable to be present when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy Tapachula ponchos and jackets.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as determined. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, cabbages, and other groceries. She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of enough water storage facilities. 

Lucy will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy a  water tank to store sufficient clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will grow economically and sustain her family and business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Rosestella
